name: Amity Lodge Motel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We called to inquire about a one-bedroom or studio unit for two people. When only a two-bedroom unit was available, rather than turn us away the owner very kindly offered it to us at the one-bedroom rate; we thought this showed a lot of class. The room itself was spacious, modern, comfortable, functional, and exceptionally clean. Well-stocked kitchenette, modern bathroom, comfortable bed, quality linens, SPOTLESS carpets, lots of space to hang/place clothes, comfortable lounge, large table, small balcony. We would not hesitate to stay again and recommend it highly to other travelers.
reviews.title: Excellent accommodations

reviews.text: We stayed here for a couple of nights in a two bedroomed unit. Jo gave us a very warm welcome and plenty of ideas of local activities.
reviews.title: Friendly place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The unit was well sized with a useful kitchen. There was also a floor-standing fan which was certainly needed.
reviews.title: Good handy location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Others have mentioned the steep walk back from town but this didn't bother us as we needed the exercise :-)
reviews.title: Great Queenstown Motel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We will certainly stay again on our next visit to Queenstown.
reviews.title: Very nice place near everything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Jo was very friendly we got a lot of help from her. Had a great apartment with a nice balcony attached to the room. Great view from the room as well. Very close to the city center - 5 mins walk to anything, adequate parking space.
reviews.title: Very Nice Motel
Handy to everything
reviews.text: Good spot handy to all Queenstown has to offer. Clean and tidy, had a 2 bed unit plenty off room for the kids. Owners very helpful about what to do and they put up with our daughter constantly throwing the ball for their dog. Poor dog would have been glad for us to go! Great recommendations about must do's.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were delighted with our accommodation, it was lovely to have a separate bedroom. The standard of the room was high, very clean and modern. The hosts were very friendly and helpful on arrival. We only had two nights but they pointed out things to do of interest. It was great to have off street parking as parking in town is limited. We didn't have a problem with the small hill back from town and walked in/out every time. We thought it was better to be slightly up the hill as there wasn't any traffic noise which you would definitely get one road closer to the town.
reviews.title: Excellent accommodation, helpful hosts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Large room with separate bedroom, good sized kitchen area, balcony with lovely mountain view. Room was clean and comfortable. Amity lodge is located a couple of small streets away from the main road into town which is quite a steep hill so if you have mobility issues you may struggle to walk into town but otherwise it is just a few minutes walk and you are right in the centre of everything. We walked for the exercise! in fact, we parked our car and didn't have to use it until we visited Arrowtown. Considering its close location to town, Amity Lodge was in a very quiet area. Would stay here again - highly recommended.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: Amity Lodge is a great place and a great value. We got a large room with separate bedroom and good sized kitchen area. Rooms were clean and well attended to. If you can walk a few blocks, then it is just a few minutes from town. We parked our car and didn't get in it again until we were going out of town. The center of Queenstown can be noisy at night, but the Amity was wisper quiet at all hours. Doug and Jo were very attentive and friendly. And they even have a dog-in-residence that is more than willing to play a few rounds of catch!
reviews.title: Best value for what you get in Queenstown

reviews.text: Amity Lodge was exactly what we needed for our week long stay in Queenstown and surprisingly the rooms and entire lodge were exactly as depicted on their web site.
reviews.title: Spot on

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a 1 bed unit with our 11 yr old and never felt cramped. The bedroom offered a queen and single bed, both with plenty of bedding for cool nights and electric blankets if needed.
reviews.title: Friendly Hosts, Great Location, Value for money

reviews.text: The lounge / kitchen area offered comfortable seating for all with a small but adequate kitchen area and a large flat screen TV.
reviews.title: Excellent location and Excellent service

reviews.text: The laundry room is a bonus when you've been on the road and the discreet washing line and pegs were very handy on dry blustery days.
reviews.title: Great location and value for money... friendly hosts

reviews.text: Lovely views of the mountains and above the town centre so protected from the noise of the bars and restaurants around the Mall. Yes, Amity Lodge is up a fairly steep hill from town but this is Queenstown after all. Some of the priciest accommodations in town are at the top of heartbreaking hills and a walk after dinner might even be a good thing.
reviews.title: Friendly operators, convenient location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 3 nights in January. Very comfortable and quiet; our room, on top floor had small balcony at front with lovely view towards gondola. Had evening sun so ideal to sit out and enjoy a drink after a hectic day. Had all the facilities we needed. Friendly helpful owners.
reviews.title: A good base

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for one night in late April. The apartment was extremely spacious with a separate, extremely clean and had a nice view up to Bob's Peak. The owners were very friendly. Old school bathroom on first inspection but the shower was superb! A short walk into town.
reviews.title: Great value and big apartment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hi,
reviews.title: Lovely Stay

reviews.text: My partner and I stayed here during our trip to Queenstown and had a wonderful stay.
reviews.title: Enjoyed the stay

reviews.text: Cannot thank the owners enough. They helped book activities for us and even drove us to one of the sites as we had to be there within 15 mins of us arriving there. They also gave us tips on where was good to visit around Queenstown. We ended up staying an extra night because our plans changed at the last minute. Also helped us out with laundry and willing to keep it open for us for some last minute washing.
reviews.title: Nothing fancy but served the purpose

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the one-bedroom unit upstairs. The motel provides basic but clean rooms. Our unit is in the older building (the white one which featured on their website). The living room is spacious and has mountain view (although the other block somehow in the way) but could get quite hot in the afternoon when it gets a lot of sun. The bedroom is cool throughout the day.
reviews.title: Basic but clean

reviews.text: Location is not bad - less than 10mins walk into the Queenstown CBD. The bus stop is only 1 min walk away - buses run to and from airport every 15 mins (NZ$6 pp).
reviews.title: Fantastic motel, great location and base for Queenstown

reviews.text: Price at NZ$165 per night is very reasonable by Queenstown standards.
reviews.title: Perfect for a home base in Queenstown

reviews.text: My only issue is that the bed is a little soft for me. But having said that, I do prefer rock-hard beds so it might not be a problem for others.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all a satisfactory stay.
reviews.title: One of the best motels we have visited

reviews.text: We arrived at Amity after a long journey and were welcomed by the motel to an excellent suite which was spotlessly clean and very modern. It was within easy walking distance from the town and well located.
reviews.title: Excellent all round service

reviews.text: Doug was very helpful and friendly and liked to get to know his visitors.
reviews.title: The Best

reviews.text: The 4 of us stayed here during our hard earned Christmas break and had a very pleasant stay. Service was great, Rooms very quiet and the managers went out of there way to ensure we had a great time. THANKS
reviews.title: Brilliant place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After much research on where to stay in Queenstown we picked Amity Lodge.
reviews.title: "great Value holiday place"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It lived up to expectation. Accommodation was great, good size, nice and quiet and didn't get too hot either which was good after we had been out all day.
reviews.title: Great location, friendly staff

reviews.text: The motel is quiet but close to the main road and local buses. There is a bus that goes regularly to and from the airport. Easy walk to the main Queenstown shopping area but remember that Queenstown is hilly - the bus even goes from Queenstown shops to a stop (less than100m) near the motel. It was great to have a kitchen area where simple meals could be had rather than constantly living in dining areas in a hotel. The staff are excellent, friendly and professional. Would stay again at this motel.
reviews.title: Convenient motel near conference venue

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Amity Lodge is an excellent motel located within easy walking distance (7 to 10 minutes) of downtown Queenstown. Each unit is like a separate small condo unit. Our was on the upper level and offered excellent views of the gondola hill and distant mountains beyond the lake. We considered other B&Bs outside of town, but we ultimately decided since we wanted to spend time in downtown Queenstown we should pick a motel within walking distance to save time and parking hassles. We are glad we chose Amity Lodge!
reviews.title: Excellent Motel

reviews.text: Great for couples or small families, the location is great- close enough to the town center, but far enough away to have a quieter, residential feel. Well- appointed kitchen gives options to dine in. On site parking a bonus. Recommend.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay and our chats with the manager.

reviews.text: This is the second time my family have stayed here and we would go back again. Doug and Jo are great hosts. The motel is located just a short walk to the town center (there are some hills though!). Being close to town was important to us as we didn't want the hassle of taking the car into Queenstown as traffic and parking can be an issue. The motels are moderately priced, clean, tidy and functional. Probably more suited to the slightly older family as limited offerings for younger kids. The dog will never get tired of you throwing tennis balls for him though! :)
reviews.title: Would Recommend

reviews.text: Located in the quieter motel / upscale apartment area southeast of downtown, off Stanley Street. There is a view of the Skyline Gondola and peak. The units are larger sized with big living/dining room, which is good compared to the tiny hotel rooms right in noisy downtown. It is super clean with great beds and a tub. Jo is so helpful with restaurant advice, airport transfers, etc. and gladly stored my suitcase in a locked storeroom between hikes. Very highly recommended!
reviews.title: Great Location in Quiet Area SE of Downtown with Large Rooms

reviews.text: We stayed in a 2 bedroom unit, which was nice and spacious for the 3 of us. Two well sized bedrooms, one with its own TV, with one more TV in the lounge. It had its own kitchen, which helped us reduce our eating out costs. The lodge was conveniently located close to town and the staff were helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: Would stay again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Both owners were enormously friendly and helpful. They confirmed and set up various activities for us and we provided great tips for things to do and places to eat. The room was newly renovated, clean, and spacious. The location was good, several block from the central (and very busy) part of Queenstown. Since the walk to the city center was downhill, it was five minutes into town, but at least ten coming back. The owners seem committed to making sure guests have a great stay with them.
reviews.title: Great owners

reviews.text: Myself and two girlfriends stayed at the Amity Lodge for 8 nights in November and had the TIME OF OUR LIVES - it was so hard to leave. I'm quite well travelled and always look for four things when I'm booking accommodation - safety, cleanliness, location & value for money. I found Amity Lodge after doing considerable research and it ticked all the boxes. I wanted a small apartment over a cramped hotel room (we were very grateful for the extra space in the end!), it's only a 5 to 10 minute walk into town, the apartment was immactulately clean and it was excellent value for money. What's more - Jo and Doug are the loveliest people you'll meet and SO well informed - if you're stuck for ideas about what activities you should do, where you should eat etc. - they will help you out and then some! On our arrival, Jo spent considerable time annotating the map for us pointing everything out and we kept going back during our stay to ask her op inion on certain tours we were thinking about doing - she was always helpful and handled the bookings for us too.
reviews.title: Amity Lodge - look no further

reviews.text: If you choose this place, you will not regret it. As I say, I did considerable research before settling on Amity & can tell you that it's the best value for money you will come across. Another bonus I forgot to mention - if you bring a laptop, there's in room access to high speed internet for just $30 / 7 days.
reviews.title: Comfortable and Clean Stay at the Amity Lodge Motel
Basic rooms
reviews.text: I will definately be returning to Queenstown and will look no further for accommodation.

description: If you are looking for quality, comfort and friendliness during your stay in Queenstown, Amity Lodge is the place to stay. Our lovely spacious One and Two Bedroom Apartments cater for your every need.Sky TV, Wireless Internet, kitchenette, free off street parking and just a 5 minute walk to town.
